title: Something Very Odd About the Las Vegas Shooter’s Weapons
text:
Something Very Odd About the Las Vegas Shooter’s Weapons
Wednesday, October 4, 2017 11:26
% of readers think this story is Fact. Add your two cents.
A Silver Doctors’ ex-military contact (Iraq War Combat Veteran) brings up some discrepancies with the weapons used by Stephen Pollock in the Las Vegas shooting. Hmmm….
First, there’s this:
EXCLUSIVE: photo from inside #MandalayBay shooter’s hotel room shows gun, ammo, hammer, bipod, optics @boston25 pic.twitter.com/4B2iRhquq5
From our Weapons Insider (Ex-military Iraq War Combat Veteran)
First of all, that’s 5.56 (.223) (as in AR-15/M-4) not 7.62 (AK-47) with a huge scope. That’s important. and on the scope, there is a reason that snipers use one shot with a scope, and a reason why light machine gunners don’t. When rounds are flying out of a rifle like in Las Vegas, a person is not using the scope. It is impossible. How can he see that far to just “spray and pray” from the hip at some 1000 yards away? I don’t think so.
There’s plenty of footage circling about the “4th floor”. We had our contact go over this clip:
Here’s what our insider says:
The sound from the rifle does not sound like the pops of 5.56 but the lower, more bass sounding, deeper firing (but not as low or as slow as a 50-cal, plus you’d just have body parts left and nothing much else). That sounds like 7.62 fire, like an AK, or, a 240B (think Rambo).
The footage above sounds a lot like an AK-47/7.62, which has a more destructive bullet anyway, and a lower rate of fire. A 5.56 has a faster fire rate than that. Also, that is way more than a 50 round magazine in that video, which makes me believe it was a belt fed 7.62 rifle, but obviously they did not use a belt linked with tracer fire (too much of a US military/false flag give-away).
If it was not belt fed, how does a sixty year old weakling man-handle a 10 pound AK with a 100 round magazine underneath? He’s not going to, but let’s give him the benefit of the doubt.
So Rambo is shooting from the shoulder (unlikely with scope, even with the “bi-pod”,) or he’s shooting from the hip, but that brings out another problem: If it was a “butt stock bumper” (or whatever they call it) producing the automatic fire rate, you mean to tell me he was rockin’ the rifle and controlling such a massive amount of recoil in what is obviously not just a 50 round magazine?
This does not add up at all.

Just me
If you’re a gun guy none of this makes sense.
No muzzle flash at the assumed sniper nest.
Sounds like a much larger caliber than .223
100 plus round bursts.
Too many guns in the hideout.
Too long for leo to get there (1hour and 20 minutes)????
The list goes on and on.  It make the Boston hoaxathon look legitimate.
Oct 4, 2017, 3:02 pm
What made you think he is a weakling?  Was he ill?
Playing the devils advocate:
I thought that right away,  that no weapon that does not load strips or rolls of bullets could possibly spray a barrage of metal that big.
As far as the scope goes,  perhaps he didn’t want to bother with trying to handle a gun and binoculars at the same time.
I do not believe he is the dude who did it.  As I say,  I think he was just the Oswald.
Oct 5, 2017, 12:05 am
The guy who could tell us all his conveniently dead.  Guns scattered around like somebody could have just placed them there.
They are the popular AR-15 type.  The most popular gun the Demoncraps want BANNED!  Coincidence???
But then again, what else could he want or have?  Those guns are popular, available everywhere and can be modified anyway you want.
What else is there available for a lone kitten?
Oct 5, 2017, 1:30 am
Rockledge
Perhaps you would be taken more seriously if you learned to spell “Democrat”.
I am thinking  it would take some serious engineering to turn a
single shot rifle that holds a dozen shells  into something you could click off hundreds a minute out of.
What kind of rapid reloading device did he have on them?   Were they belt fed?
Oct 9, 2017, 8:06 am
The variable cadence of the fire sounds like a hand-cranked Gatling gun. People make them in 45acp so AK 7.62 is not beyond the bounds of possibility. The full version of this video at half way has a burst of fire that rises and falls in rate, like someone who’s tired using a hand-crank. You can watch someone using a Bulldog repro Gatling on Youtube who cranks it up to 880 rounds per minute near the end. If it wasn’t a Gatling, it still sounds hand-cranked. If shooting came from the 4th floor was the window broken, as windows aren’t able to be opened in Mandalay Bay above a certain level, I don’t know which?
Oct 5, 2017, 7:35 am
